attributes.action: reinstate the award of the General Service Medal for those personnel mobilised or deployed in support of active operations around the world but not actually serving in a combat zone, e.g. deployed in Bahrain, Qatar, Oman, etc, supporting but not serving in Iraq or Afghanistan (for which there are seperate campaign medals).
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Recognition should be given to those personnel deployed in areas adjacent to combat zones who are supporting active operations but who not qualify for a campaign medal. The General Service Medal, discontinued in 1999 (with the exception of still being awarded for service in Northern Ireland) would be ideal for this occasion and would not necessitate the creation of a new medal. Personnel, both regular and reserve, should be recognised for the valuable  contribution they make to operations, and for the fact that they are deployed far from home for long periods of time in some inhospitable, and often unsafe, locations.
